text: Map of Prince Patrick Island, showing Crozier Channel The Crozier Channel () is a natural waterway through the central Canadian Arctic Archipelago in the Northwest Territories of Canada. It separates Prince Patrick Island (to the north-west) and Eglinton Island (to the south-east). It opens into the McClure Strait at its southern end. It is named for the explorer, Francis Crozier; one of several such memorials in the Canadian Arctic. Category:Bodies of water of the Northwest Territories Category:Channels of Canada Category:Channels of the Arctic Ocean
title: Crozier Channel
